result.execSummary:
The defendant Clint J. BLAHA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Deliver Methamphetamine(<=3g) - 2nd offense [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver (>3-10g) - 2nd offense [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change from DOC indicating defendant's extended supervision revoked - sentenced to prison effective 04-29-2016

The defendant has successfully completed the Challenge Incarceration Program as of 09-14-15.
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
Cover letter.

Transcript of sentencing hearing held on 04-10-14.
Original transcript is on file in case no: 13 CF 337.
Copy of transcript of sentencing hearing delivered to Registrar along with defendant.

Defendant in custody.
ON COUNT 7-  DELIVER METHAMPHETAMINE-2ND OFFENSE:
The defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of four (4) years.  That is two (2) years initial confinement followed by two (2) years extended supervision.
ON COUNT 8 - POSSESS METHAMPHETAMINE WITH INTENT TO DELIVER-2ND OFFENSE:
The defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of thirty-eight (38) months.  That is fourteen (14) months initial confinement followed by two (2) years extended supervision, consecutive to the sentence imposed on count 7.
The Court finds the defendant eligible for both the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
ON COUNT 1- BAIL JUMPING:
Sentence is withheld and the defendant is placed on probation to DOC for three (3) years, consecutive to the prison sentences presently being served on counts 7 and 8 of this case, to commence upon defendant's discharge  date after extended supervision ends.
Conditions of both extended supervision and probation:
1) Pay court costs;
2) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC;
3) maintain absolute sobriety;
4) assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's Assessment process;
5) Submit to random urine screens and pay for same;
6) Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
The defendant has credit of 49 days.
The balance of cash bail on 13 CF 337 is ordered applied to court costs.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.
GUILTY pleas entered to counts 1, 7 and 8; bail jumping, deliver Methamphatamine-2nd offense and possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver-2nd offense.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 through 6.  Motion granted.
Sentencing is set for 04-10-14 at 9:30 a.m.

Search warrant issued.  RE:  Samsung Galaxy S4 Cellular telephone owned by Clint J. Blaha.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver, 2 counts deliver Methamphetamine, deliver Methamphetamine as repeater and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-03-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
